Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the happening place...”
Reviews.Author: kelvinyam
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in this hotel and found it to be meeting my expectation. The location is about 10-15 minutes walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame. And it's next to a fast food restaurant - In and Out which is superbly affordable and delicious. The room was ok, with a balcony facing the swimming pool. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Sufficient towels and bathroom amenities were provided and room was cleaned upon every return. WiFi was free of charge in the room and signal strength was acceptable. Breakfast was basic. No hot food. There were generous selections of cornflakes / cereal though. Coffee was too thin. Will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel well positioned”
Reviews.Author: clarkaj6
Reviews.Content: ideal for hollywood good rooms close to all attractions tour buses pick up/drop off at hotel.though one of main companies main offices is about 400 metres away.simple breakfast but you can find enough to eat..would recommend 5 nights spent in April

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff within walking or short drive of major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Shupagirl
Reviews.Content: First trip to LA so a little nervous about where to stay. After reading several reviews decided this would be safe and fairly cheap. Pros - quick walk to Hollywood walk of fame, easy drive to Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, the Grove, etc. Super nice staff, cheap parking, free wifi, next door to In and Out Burger Cons - TINY room, very old, window faced a corridor so we had to keep the curtains pulled all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good management, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ljpeas
Reviews.Content: Location central on Sunset. Bed comfortable. Napoleon the manager was excellent. Breakfast was poor. No frills staying its fine

Reviews.Title: “Good location and is a value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Chan84
Reviews.Content: First up, I am a no frills person when it comes to choosing hotel. Only two things matter to me, location and cleanliness. Hotel is 5 mins walk to Hollywood Boulevard and very near to the metro. Room is neat, no stains in the toilet. Room is big and comfortable. Other good things include: simple but feeling breakfast. parking is 8 dollars for whole day. Staff are generally helpful. There is grocery and petrol station nearby. In and out burger joint is just beside the hotel too. Things I wish would be better. The lightings in my room were real dim.

Reviews.Title: “All you could want”
Reviews.Author: BobthePoet
Reviews.Content: Stayed nine nights. This is right in the heart of Hollywood - a ten minute walk to the Boulevard and surrounded by a variety of fast-food emporia. The room was enormous, well equipped and clean. Outdoor, heated, and very clean pool was very under-used and I recommend it after a day tramping the 'Walk', Universal, Warner Bros. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DMitch8114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012 after seeing "Wicked" at the Pantages theatre. Great location to walk to many Hollywood attractions. Lots of places to eat within walking distance. Hotel had clean rooms, great breakfast and very friendly staff. Let us keep our car in their parking next morning after check out while we walked around Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DaveyBoysTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night, staff v friendly & happy to assist with all queries. Room was a great size with all amenities. Short walk to walk of fame & metro to downtown. Parking is $8 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Deniz91
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great for anyone wanting to see the typical L.A site. it a short 3-5 min walk to the shopping centre, walk of fame, madame tussauds, Mc donalds and about a 10min taxi ride to universal studios. right across the road is an Ihop and In and Out burgur (best burgur ive ever had!) and 5 walk to a 7/eleven, burgur king, pizza shop, coffee place. theres a bus stop right infront of the hotel that takes you to the grove and farmers market. the rooms are for those who are only going to sleep there and spend most of the time out , though at night there would be people in the streets making so much noise past midnight its a great budget hotel! seriously would not find a better location then this hotel. rooms are clean, though the carpets were a little damp for some reason. be warned the street facing the hotel and that suburb is really shonkey and then the street facing famous toursit attractions is nice and clean. i dont think you will find a better budget hotel in this location that doesnt cost an arm and a leg

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zomgitsally
Reviews.Content: Clean and well kept hotel. Great simple free breakfast and staff were very friendly. The bed was extremely comfortable! Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location but is in a bad need of repair!”
Reviews.Author: KenandTammy
Reviews.Content: They do try and keep the hotel clean, however the rooms and the carpets are in bad need of updating. We found the following problems: the safe did not work and we had to use the hotel safe for cash and passports, the hair dryer did work, they were to have WiFi in the rooms but the signal was not strong enough and always had to go down to the lobby. The breakfast provided was really good and was included in the room price. Simply due to the poor upkeep I would rate this hotel at a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Elisinha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a block away from Hollywood Blvd (Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre...). Staff was friendly and great. Rooms are clean. The hotel has a pool. My room by the pool wasn't the best though, It was a bit noisy by there. Young people can usually get loud. Besides that, no complains.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Bos2n
Reviews.Content: Continuing on our budget trip, this hotel fit in perfectly. $100 on Sunset Blvd, 2 blocks away from the Chinese and Kodak Theaters. The location cant be beat. Sure it isn't the cleanest or most organized, but that's ok, we weren't in LA to stay in our room. There was free breakfast and wifi, parking was only $8 per day. The front desk staff was very helpful. Again, for $100, how can you complain?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the sights of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AliBO2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our stay in Los Angeles. It was a good, clean hotel to base yourself at. The staff were friendly, and there were plenty of eateries within a minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris8011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us , by a friend. I looked at it online , read some reviews, and booked it for our stay in Los Angeles. Don't take a taxi from the airport, take the a hotel shuttle bus. It's much cheaper. Upon arriving at Days Inn, we found the staff very helpful regarding how to get around and see LA. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is a short walk from Hollywood Boulevard and everything that LA has to offer. I would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: johnson062610
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to L.A. and stayed at the Days Inn. The location is OUTSTANDING if you're wanting to sightsee. I was able to walk to pretty much all the big sights I wanted to see. If you're not planning on spending a lot of time in the room, this place should be perfect. The room wasn't bad and was very clean. The walls were a bit thin, but I may have just had noisy neighbors. The tv didn't have much variety for channels, but it did have HBO and "The Golden Globes," so I was good. I liked that the parking garage was gated, that you needed a key to get onto your floor, and that there was security. It put me at ease while I was traveling alone. Great bang for your buck if you'd like to be close to everything and not pay a ton!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hook1999
Reviews.Content: Coming to Hollywood many times, this was the first time I stayed here. The room T.V. was a flatscreen, but channels were very limited. The bathroom was pretty cool, but watch in the shower because the tile is slippery. Within walking distance of the Chinese theatre, Kodak theatre, and many great restaurant and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: Overall the propery is nice and clean. This is an older property with very thin walls. We were next to a family who had an infant so needless to say we were up every two hours as well. Also it would have been nice to know that their parking garage is only for vehicles that are less than 6 feet tall.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, great free breakfast.....fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: sazkebab
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in November for 4 nights. The rooms are basic, but clean and comfortable. The location of this hotel is fantastic.....For those who have never been to LA...it is massive. This hotel is central for everything and I would recommend to everyone visiting the area. It is a 4 min walk to Hollywood Boulevard with loads of places to eat on your doorstep. Parking was very cheap for the area and is gated. All LA tours leave from chinese theatre which is right on your doorstep. The free breakfast was great......and FREE, which was great for our morning needs. Cant fault this hotel for the price. Will stay again should we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget stay”
Reviews.Author: milkcandies
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October. I like the location because it's so convenient - within 10 minutes stroll to Hollywood Boulevard and yet away from the hustle and bustle, there's an In and Out burger joint right next to it for quick breakfast fix before setting off for the day, an Ihop open 24hrs just across the road which I went one night for waffles for supper, a number of small eateries in the corner about 5mins walk away with a provision shop in the same car park, a laundry shop about 10 min stroll on the right of the hotel, and a shoe outlet diagonally opposite the hotel. I like it as it's right on the Sunset Boulevard which is nicely lined with tall palms trees. The room is decently clean and a comfortable size (not really spacious nor was it cramp) although there is a musky smell. There is a microwave oven and hot water flask. But there is no view (you can request for one facing the road by paying more but the rooms are very limited). Breakfast is very simple - toast with jam, cereals, beverages and one kind of fruit. Overall, for this price, I find this place pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....”
Reviews.Author: GinaBear
Reviews.Content: Was a clean place to stay on Sunset near Hollywood Blvd (approx 2 blocks). Hotel was overbooked. We reserved a queen non-smoking. Did not have one available. Were given a suite w/ a mini kitchen instead! (which was great to have with two small boys to feed). Breakfast was the standard continental breakfast. Not bad. Bagels and fruit were fresh. Room was clean. Plenty of parking. Felt safe in this hotel. Yes, there were probs with the key card but that was about it. Staff was very nice. Reasonably priced. Would definitely stay there next time I travel to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Reasonably Priced in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBoy1955
Reviews.Content: This location is on Sunset Blvd, a block or so from Hollywood Blvd (near the main Hollywood attractions). Priced reasonably for this area. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Seemed to have some trouble with the keycard not working (this happened twice - stayed there 3 days). The indoor garage is $8.00 per day which you would need as parking on the street is very difficult as most areas are permitted or metered. The continental breakfast was just OK, no waffle maker, no yogurt (although they had bananas and apples), no eggs of any sort, had oatmeal and bagels and danish and cereal and juice. I like Starbucks coffee and even though there was a Starbucks on the corner I didnt go there as the coffee was fine. Breakfast bar opened at 6:30 AM promptly. As I said my rates were very reasonable (used the Entertainment Book discount) and accordingly my room was small but sufficient for only myself. Had to unglog the refrigerator as it was quite noisy - also a microwave in room. I liked the fact that there was a safe in the room free of charge. The internet was a little slow but free. There was no suitcase rack in the room when I arrived but one was delivered promptly. I would recommend a room on the upper level rather than on the main level. My room led out to a courtyard in the back of the hotel with a gate perhaps four feet high leading to the courtyard (no access to the courtyard). The courtyard was protected with barbed wire but I didn't feel comfortable leaving the sliding door open during the night which was the only source of outdoor ventilation. The bathroom area was small but nice and shower was newly tiled. The desk personnel were friendly and helpful and allowed for a late check out on departure day. Didnt use the outdoor pool (was there in the second week of December, 2011) but ate a midnight snack from In/Out Burger (which is next door (had to try it as there are none of those on the east coast) - 24 hr IHOP is across the street as well as a 7/11 - saw an altercation while taking a walk with a security guard from 7/11 and someone who must have tried to help himself without paying for his items) in the pool area. The outdoor pool area was well kept and attractive. About 3 blocks east is on Sunset Blvd is a guitar center that has a walk of fame in front of the building with many famous bands and singers - worth the walk. I dont think they had a fitness center but there is a nice L A Fitness about a 7 minute walk on Hollywood Blvd. All in all - a good place and a a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lilfi1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights & was happy overall with my stay. Room was a decent size with a fridge, desk & plenty of towels in the bathroom. as others have said the walls are very thin & could hear the people in the next room. Breakfast was bagels, toast, pastries, cereal, fruit, juice & coffee. But came down at 9:30am and there wasn't much left & wasn't refilled either. Less than 10min walk to Hollywood Blvd but Sunset isn't the nicest area. Ross across the street is awesome for clothes bargains. Overall I would stay here again & recommend it to those looking for a reasonable priced place close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: keenastraveller
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with this hotel, our room faced the in and out car park and the noise didn't really bother us. The bed was super comfy and I slept well, although 1 night there was a tap on the door and lucky they have peep holes as I was reluctant to open the door,, and the maintenance man asked us if our shower was leaking and as far as i knew it wasn't. He came in and checked it, flushed the toilet ,did a bit of looking around found nothing and said that the room in the below the bath had flooded and it seemed the water was coming from our room. Well it must of been a busted pipe somewhere as he belted on it for the next couple of hours. I couldn't sleep due to this and of all nights we were getting up at 4am to go to the airport. Anyway the clock hit 2am and the next thing there were shots being fired in the in and out next door and I'm lying there thinking were all gonna die as this is the first time ever I have heard a real life non movie gun being fired, so I froze until I heard the police sirens then got up and looked out the window. If the police hadn't of been walking around the carpark with torches looking for bullet casings I would of thought I was dreaming as people were just walking around like nothing had happened. Turned out shots were fired into store but no one was hurt. The breakfast that was included was plentiful ( i'm not a big brekkie eater) toast, fruits, cereals, croissants, juices, coffee and tea. We would of liked a refrigerator in the room, but I found in most places we stayed in America they didn't have them in the room unless you paid something like $25. The pool looked ok, though we didn't get a chance to use it The location is fantastic, just down the road from the Walk of Fame, Madame Tussards and highland mall, the Ihop is across the road and a unbelievable shoe warehouse across the road too. Just a short walk along sunset there is a shopping arcade i forget the name but there is a good laundromat there. The reception staff are very helpful, I tend to ask thousands of questions and they answered everyone with a smile. Security was good, you have to swipe your room card to use the lift or enter via the side door and I did see a security guard walking around the night of the shooting. I would definitely stay there next time I'm in L.A

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but don't expect a smile after your stay.”
Reviews.Author: Adhitia H
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, yes it is. three blocks away from central Hollywood tourist destinations, two thumbs up for this. Room quality is really average, carpet and bathroom are a little bit dirty and seems the room cleaner not putting much effort on cleaning the room while you away on the day time. Expect noise from In and Out burger next door (always busy days and night), heaps of people park their car there and the noise of the engine and horn straight to your room and yes this happened on weekdays too. Receptionist is quite helpful, they are willing to help for early check-in if needed and I can see their efforts on this. and for an in house breakfast, better find something else close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: chris t
Reviews.Content: Nothing flash but great value. Room was more than ok and clean and location was brilliant. Surprisingly quiet too considering where it is. Staff were more than helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: spur61
Reviews.Content: clean comfortable room and in a great location, sadly we had a very loud german who chose to speak on the phone in the early hours for a long time!! the walls were thin to the point we could hear the person on the other end of the line!! so they need to do something about the sound insulation!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: smallpond
Reviews.Content: The location on Sunset is within an easy walking distance to Hollywood Blvd (Chinese Theater, Walk of Fame, etc.) and very close to several restaurants. The underground parking garage was a nice bonus and it allowed us to come in and out throughout the day as we explored the city. Beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. I found it strange there was an additional charge to get a room with two doubles (vs. a queen - 2 adults). Since it was November, there was little noise from the pool area (where the main window looks out). Traffic noise was there, but not horrible. The room walls are thin though and we ended up calling the front desk to see if our neighbors could be quieter. Room was clean. Oddities include a shower head designed for people under 5' tall and a microwave from the 1980s. The continental breakfast was eh, so we hit IHOP across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NorwichLisa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly basic but is great for a base from which to explore. Close to Hollywood Boulevard and the metro station which will take you downtown or to Universal Studios. Rooms were a good size and the free breakfast is a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, secure and clean.”
Reviews.Author: travellersarge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice over a few weeks while traveling around and I found this a good place to stay. Rooms were clean and secure. Breakfast was included and it is in a very good location, just a short walk from the Walk of Fame etc.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about location location location”
Reviews.Author: SammyinLA
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this place. Was a bit dubious of the Days Inn chain as they seem very budget, but I've changed my opinion. The staff were all very friendly, rooms compact but functional, all very clean. I cannot say a bad thing about it. It is literally a 5 minute walk to the Chinese Theatre. I'd read that, but didn't really believe it considering the price I was paying, but it is. Within 2 minute walk on Sunset there is an IHOP, 7/11, mini shopping centre with Hawaiian fast food (really yummy, so recommend it), nail studio, hungry jacks, laundry, bottle shop, you name it. And the best part...the most fantastic shoe shop I have ever seen in my life just across the road..Off Broadway Shoe Warehouse, ladies you HAVE to go there. I made the mistake of going in there on my final day...I should have gone there earlier, but then I might have spent my whole 3 days there!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: Good location, walking distance to Hollywood Blvd. (star bucks half a block walk ) quick drive to Universal and Warner Brothers. Room was slightly worn, but expected due to age and location, continental breakfast was not up to par compared to other Days Inn I have stayed at. Parking FEE was a surprise but at least it was in a secure garage Overall it was ok, I have stayed in worse

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: davidjones533
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the start of a road-trip. The hotel is very conveniently located very close to the Chinese Theatre and other attractions on Hollywood Bvld, although it is a long walk from the classic end of Sunset Bvld. There’s a burger place next door and an iHop opposite, but it’s only a short-walk to the restaurants of the Kodak complex. The room was clean and comfortable with a very large TV, and surprisingly quiet given how busy Sunset Bvld can get. We were somewhat shocked, however, not to have an outside window. Instead, the large window quite bizarrely looked out onto hallway, almost as if the external walls of the hotel are a new addition. The whole arrangement seems rather pointless, as few people will be happy to be in full view of passers-by. However, we just shut the curtains and didn't let it bother us. Other than that, the hotel is generally comfortable, with a large and sunny pool. Breakfast is acceptable, although the use of paper plates and plastic forks is an American custom I can't get used to. Parking was secure and we had no problem with spaces, and although it's an additional paid for extra, it's still a bargain for LA. Overall, the hotel is a good compromise between price and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good location !”
Reviews.Author: LaFemmeScarlet
Reviews.Content: Very good location at Hollywood! it's really convenient as headquarters to move around the city! a block away from the Roosevelt Hotel, and all the attractions at the Boulevard (Walk of fame, Madame Toussaud museum, Hollywood & Highland stores, Grauman's theater, etc) lots of shopping and restaurants all around! The room was really clean, just a little small, but comfortable, it had all the amenities, extra towels and pillows, very quiet. They do have a parking fee, 8 usd tax included per day, but cars are really safe behind an electric door with security guard. The night staff at the front desk wasn't very friendly but everything else was really good I would defintely go back to this hotel when staying in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gavleng
Reviews.Content: We found this place a great base to explore Hollywood. Ok it's not five star and could do with updating, but for the price it is fantastic value and we could not fault it. The rooms were on the small side but very clean and comfortable with all the basics you would expect from a hotel in this price range. The location is great and only minutes walk from Hollywood boulevard and its many attractions and the location felt safe with lots of people using the nearby fast food outlets. Breakfast was basic but very nice with plenty of choice and great coffee. Parking was easy and only cost a few dollars a day. WI-FI was not very fast and the signal was quite poor the further you got from reception, but it is free and was good enough to skype with. Overall this place is good, especially for the price. If you want somewhere with bigger/better rooms, faster wi-fi and better reception then I would suggest paying more money to stay elsewhere. If you expect to get what you pay for then this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Amy368
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if using as a base. We stayed for one night before we flew out to Florida. I couldnt have stayed there more than a couple of nights though. Location-wise, it was handy for the underground (2 minute walk to the station). It was about a 20 minute walk down to the stars and the chinese theatre etc. Opposite was a Ralphs and a Quiznos, which was handy! The pool was small, but clean! They did have a breakfast room, but we didnt utilise that. The decoration of the outside of the building was murals of hollywood legends, which was a great touch! The inside of the rooms were basic, but clean. We had a problem with the fridge, which they happily changed. All in all, i would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DAG-5YrPlan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good deal for those seeking to experience the glitz and glam of hollywood on a budget. The hotel is a short walk to the Chinese Theater, which is certainly worth taking a look at. Parking is available for a small fee, which is awesome, because parking in Hollywood is an expensive nightmare. The rooms are definitely showing signs of use, but it was a clean, comfortable place to go to bed after a night exploring the town. Breakfast is included, but its not the best spread and it can be rather cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tamarah7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited in April 2011 and really enjoyed Hollywood. Great location and great value for what you pay. Clean, large rooms. Only complaint about the room was that our window opened onto the hallway and people could look in - ask for a balcony room. We weren't in iot enough to let it bother us though. Close to all attractions, public bus and underground systems. Staff not rude but not very helpful. The staff were not very knowledgable about the local area or tourist info. Very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: LizzyDashwood
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for our first night in LA (we stayed close to Venice for the rest of our week in LA). The hotel was a 5 minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard. It has free wi-fi, underground parking ($8 per day and we left our car there after we checked out to go exploring). This was a cheap and cheerful option for us - the breakfast was basic, the staff friendly, the room small but clean. I wouldn't stay here for a full week, but if you are looking for one night close to Hollywood attractions, this is the place for you. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RR99_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for one night on the way to Universal Studios, great location walking distance to Kodak. Room was very clean, room for family of 5 was sufficient. Breakfast was simple but very nice and clean. I was very worried about this hotel but we were very pleasantly surprised how nice it was, even with a room facing sunset boulevard there was no noise. Car park was excellent and safe, underground locked parking for only $8.

Reviews.Title: “Passing through”
Reviews.Author: Frankles71
Reviews.Content: Myself and girlfriend had just driven down from San Francisco and as we stayed in the Days Inn last year we thought lets see if we can stay again. We hadn't booked so we drove up to the entrance (you get 10 minutes free parking) I was greeted by a friendly member of staff who immediately said 'yes we have a room'. The room was just what we needed and the location is just right, 10 mins to Hollywood walk of fame and if driving a 20 minute drive to Santa Monica. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price, cleanliness and location, there's also an ATM for connivence, a nearby 7 eleven and the famous In and out burger restaurant. The next time we visit LA we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: LolaBrasil
Reviews.Content: Hotels in LA (not Downtown) seens very expensive for what they are. This hotel is simple, but nice. Not noisy, great breakfast, very good location. You may walk to the Subway, Hard Rock Cafe, to great stores, restaurants, there is a Pub acroos the street to watch Season Plays, eat, grab a cold Bier, or even Sing! ( karaoke some nights). The room is small, but fits our bags, the bed is not King, but it's not also little. The bathroom is better and clean. But it's an old hotel, old carpet on the Hall, if you are looking for too much of a confort, better not to go. But if you want to sleep nice, have a breakfast with several juices, breads, fruit and cereal, and walk to some places, instead of grabing a car every second, there you might stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RitzAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we were after. It was very reasonably priced, we could walk to Hollywood Boulevard in just a few minutes. The breakfast was nice, the pool area was also nice. The hotel gave us an early check in which as much appreciated after a 13 hour flight from NZ. The room was a little dark but it didnt bother us. We would highly recommend it and would stay here again on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal & location!”
Reviews.Author: misworld7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few minutes away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame. I chose this hotel based on customer reviews and was delighted to find that those reviews were accurate. Parking is affordable and very secure, rooms are clean although a little small, the staff is helpful, the free breakfast is awesome and the pool was just a bonus! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, VERY CLEAN ROOMS, LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: erikson h
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying with a Days Inn, it was so great. we are coming from germany. me and my family had much fun. The location was fabulous. Close to chinesse theatre, kodac theatre and many more locations. GREAT SERVICE!! i will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Nienna82
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much but I was wrong. Room was clean, there was a microwave owen, fridge and safe. It was spacious enough and the air conditioning worked well. I was also happy with the breakfast. Unlike the writer before me said, there are fruits, bread, danish and cereals. The location couldn't be better. Only small problem was that the window was to the corridor, not outside. But you can live with that.

Reviews.Title: “Worst days Inn Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heat78
Reviews.Content: Room was very disappointed.  I didn't get wifi in my room Hall way is really dirty and smell bed. My bath room was mold and there was a  lot of damages In the furnitures. I couldn't sleep well because of noise at the outside. I booked 2 nights through website and wanted to check out next day but manager at the front desk told me he is going to charge my credit card anywyas because of their cancellation police. So we stayed 2 nights here and paid almost $400 because we booked double bed room. I don't think room is not value $200 per night. I always stay at days inn and this one was horrible. I am not going to stay this Days inn  ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent value for money. Would go back”
Reviews.Author: PassportUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Expedia after reading reviews on here. We wanted something central in Hollywood and were not disappointed. The Hollywood Walk of Fame, with the Stars on he street, and Grauman Chinese Theatre, with the handprints, are literally just behind the hotel, just 2 blocks, less than a 5 min walk! Also down this street are Ripleys, Mafame Tussauds, Kodak Theatre, Guiness World Records and much more. All walkable!! The rooms are fine, not 5 star but it's not a 5 star hotel. The room was spacious and clean. It had a dryer, iron and board, in room safe, fridge, microwave and tea/coffee making facilities. The hotel has free Wi-Fi, a lovely swimming pool, free continental breakfast, and secure parking at $8 a night. There are plenty of fast food places within walking distance as well as some restaurants. There is a Starbucks almost next door and a 7/11 opposite if you want beer etc for your fridge. All the staff were really pleasant. It was amazing value for money and I would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MJTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2011 for 4 nights. Excellent location on the Sunset strip. Across the road is an off broadway shoe store, IHOP and next door is an In N Out. A little higher up at La brea intersection is a Ross, BK and 7-11. So food and shopping places close by. Also a couple blocks away from Hollywood Blvd. Rooms need updating but are OK and clean. Bathrooms are clean as well. The Wifi network needs upgrading to support the usage at the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast is also OK and free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nothing negative to say!”
Reviews.Author: jodyw89
Reviews.Content: I really cant say that I have anything negative to say about this hotel. Everyone that rates this place negative are expecting a 5 star hotel which of course it isn't but it is also not priced like one either. Just go to this hotel with the right expectations. The room was a little small but again I cant complain because we didn't pay a lot for it either. The location is great. Only a few minutes away from hollywood blvd and just a few feet from IN-OUT Burger (which everyone should try) The pool was nice, there were chairs to suntan and also a few tables to eat or whatever. The continental breakfast completely past my expectations for something that was free. Just try and get there a little earlier because you wont be hit with the all the crowds. Perhaps the only downside was that there was no fitness center but there is a YMCA only a few blocks away Overall I really enjoyed my experience at this hotel and would visit again. Keep in mind, its only a place to sleep and store your stuff. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location - I'd recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: bigb1999uk
Reviews.Content: My wife, 12 year-old daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. Great location only 2 blocks from Mann's Chinese Theater, Walk of Fame etc. Clean rooms, pleasant, helpful staff and car parking reasonably priced ($8 pn) and underground carpark easily accessible. The continental-style breakfast was also very good. The pool was in decent condition and surrounds well kept. This was our 3rd trip to the area and this hotel was by far the best value for money. (previously stayed at the Beverly Hills Crowne Plaza and the other hotel has long since been replaced by the Kodak Theatre !).

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: MadamKatia
Reviews.Content: All I can say is spend a bit more and stay elsewhere. There were three good things about this place. One how close it was to the Hollywood walk of fame and the sites there. The other two, are the fact that there is an I-hop and an In-and-out burger right next store.

Reviews.Title: “would like to keep it a secret”
Reviews.Author: chippochic
Reviews.Content: My 30 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 days in April. We found this hotel on the net whilst we were in San Diego and loved the location. We previously spent a night at the Sofitel in Beverly Hills and loved it but apart from the Beverly Centre opposite, it was a bit far away from the action. We caught the train from Union Station to Hollywood and Highland and walked to the hotel. Upon arrival the foyer was modern and spacious with the pool behind it. Checking in was fine although there was a mandatory charge for the safe in the room whether or not it was used. Bizarre, but wasn't enough to argue about. The lift was tiny and the stairs and corridors were run down and in need of renovation but clean enough. I was apprehensive about the room after passing one that the window looked out onto the corridor, but thankfully that wasn't ours. Our room was fantastic. Brand new double beds with pillow tops and renovated bathroom. The mirror was awkwardly placed. The tv was an older box. The room had a little kitchenette with a coffee maker and a fridge, no cutlery and a few paper cups. The balcony was large and looked over the pool. Breakfast was included but we didn't bother after the 1st morning. Next door was an In Out Burger which my daughter loved. Across the road was a shoe warehouse, the likes of which I have never seen in Australia. Location was just behind the Roosevelt Hotel and very easy walking distance to the Kodak Theatre and all the action on Hollywood. What many people don't realise about LA is the public transport system is wonderful. We took the bus to West Hollywood, to the Farmers Markets and the train to Union Station. For a reasonable room rate and if you get one of the renovated rooms, Days Inn is a gem right in the thick of anything you may want to do in LA. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: CSJDO01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8/2-8/4. The room was the best I have EVER stayed in as far as a Days Inn, I admit I was skeptical about staying here because of other experiences in other states, but when we got to our room I was taken a back it was AWESOME! I was there with my sister and nieces who hadn't been on the west coast yet and where so excited they drove in from Minnesota to my house in Arizona. We hadn't made any room plans we were going to "shoot from the hip" so to say to find a room, got the last suite and it was only available for 1 night, we got up had out great breakfast went up to pack, I took a shot and walked down to see if we could stay another night, they didn't have our room available but another, ANNA was very helpful she's the Manager (friendly and willing to help) anyways by the time I walked back up to the room the phone had rang it was ANNA she said we could stay in our room instead of moving to another when ready. Now that I CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! Thanks for our Wonderful day, my Nieces loved it. The location is about 2-3 block walk to Hollywood Blvd and 2 mile drive to sunset strip. Thanks again for the awesome customer service and making a memorable time for us!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for a good price and great location!”
Reviews.Author: princesspm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I picked this hotel for our first trip abroad together :) This hotel is amazing. The service is great and the location is awesome. Its a 2 min walk to the Walk of Fame. Its located on Sunset Boulevard right behind the Roosevelt Hotel. Universal Studios and The Grove are about 10 minutes away (by cab). Santa Monica and Beverly Hills are about 15-20 minutes away (by cab). The only negative was that we didnt enjoy the breakfast, but every morning we ran across the street to Subway and Starbucks and ate our breakfast there instead. Our room was tidy and clean at all times. They really do a great job with cleaning the rooms. And the hotel looked very cosy and cute. I rate it 9/10. We will stay here again next time we visit LA!

Reviews.Title: “Not great on quality, but for the price no need to complain!”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: We booked the Days Inn after a friend wasn't able to get us a deal at the Magic Castle on the days we were in LA so we opted for the Days Inn on Sunset for it's central-ish location near Hollywood Boulevard which is in walking distance. We paid around £170 for two nights, which wasn't too bad. The room itself was a bit of a hotchpotch, with a very old and knackered looking fridge but a brand new flat screen TV. The bed was huge and comfortable, the bathroom pokey and whilst it wasn't 'unclean' it certainly wasn't sparkling (probably down to the age of the fittings). We doidn't have breakfast included but the hotel is directly opposite IHOP (International House Of Pancakes) so you can assail you arteries with their calorific breakfast dishes. The staff were pleasant and friendly - however, do not let them book you a taxi to the airport. We only asked them to book it because our friends couldn't give us a lift. The driver was so obnoxious and was trying to charge us more because there wasn't any traffic on the way to LAX! Needless to say, he didn't get a tip. Overall, the hotel is perfectly functionable without any luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Ehm... not so great”
Reviews.Author: laurastellina
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that this is a Motel and that it looks much prettier from the outside than the inside. I really liked the underground parking, which was not expensive. The rooms were clean, but nothing special - very basic. The walls were EXTREMELY thin, so we could hear everything from the rooms next door, but we didn't have any problems with this at night. The breakfast was included in the room rate, but again, it was very basic. The neighbourhood wasn't so great, so you won't have the "beverly hills" feeling when you go outside lol. But if you have a small budget and are looking for a place to stay in LA this is the place for you. But personally, I would not come back!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroachs in my room”
Reviews.Author: DaniLK
Reviews.Content: We killed more than 8 little cockroachs in our room. The hotel is definitely dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: munkeycreed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the July 4th holiday. We had a small room with 1 queen bed and really no view of anything but we were not in our hotel room much anyways. Also our room did not have a refridgerator in it like I thought all the rooms did so obvioulsy they dont so if that is important make sure you ask for a room with one in it. Over all though the room was very clean as well as other parts of the hotel and room service came by daily. The pool area was nice too good hang out spot at night time. Across the street is a great little bar The Happy Ending was always crowded and had a good vibe stop by if that is your type of thing. There is a lot of stuff nearby as Hollywood Blvd is just a 5 minute walk away but be careful of the crowds. I did not see to many homeless ppl and the ones I did see didnt really bother me. We walked back to the hotel late at night several times and had no problems. The hotel was safe at night as well because they had a security guard that walked around and monitored the place all night long. If you take Highland Ave to Hollywood Blvd for a walk you can see the Hollywood sign. There are a lot of hotels closer to Universal but we went for other things so that wasnt a big problem for us. The locals are very nice so if you want to know any good places to go just ask. I would recommend this hotel if you want a good deal on a nice hotel in a good location. It is not five star but for what we paid we def got our moneys worth. If I am ever in the area again I would stay back at this spot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great no frills hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no-frills, and great for families. There's an unsupervised central pool, and balconies on most of the rooms to watch over it from. The central area is secured, so it's good for children. It's not the cleanest, but it's in a great location, close to the action at Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. Other hotels that we looked at were very expensive, but the point of staying in LA is not the hotel room, right? We preferred a central base we could explore from, and didn't spend too much time at the hotel. Breakfast is included, and although it's only bagels and fruit, it was a great start to the day (and a great lunch when wrapped in napkins and stuffed in our bags!). There's a fridge, microwave and coffeemaker in the room, which was handy after a long day's sightseeing. It's also near an In-N-Out Burger, an IHOP, and there's a 7-11 across the road. I also liked being near the shopping - there's a Gap, a Ross and an H&M all within a couple of minutes walk. The hotel's proximity to the Hollywood/Highland underground station is a plus - it's only one stop away from Universal Studios, and we even got the train out to the airport on our last day (3 changes of train, but it's a LOT cheaper than a taxi!).

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable accommodation in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kshx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning and end of our US trip. While we were not able to get into our room when we arrived at 10:30am after a 14hour flight, the rest of the stay was great. Yes the rooms are small, but its a hotel room not a suite!! the beds were comfy, the rooms were clean and well maintained, the water pressure in the shower was great (at first a little too strong until we worked out how to fix it! - they have massaging heads in some rooms!). WE didnt go in the pool but it looked nice. The breakfast was fine to start the day, there was plenty of choices to save you going elsewhere. It was in a great location, we were < 5min from the hollywood stars and the Chinese theatres, and in and out burger was next door, and i hop across the road. If anything, i guess the service left something to be desired, as our first time in LA they didnt really provide us with any info or maps as we checked in - there were no maps at the desk, later to be found in the dining room. It was obvious we were from another country so perhaps some up front info / maps in the room would have been helpful. Great if you are on a budget and want a really good place to stay! would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Luck Talking to the Manager”
Reviews.Author: ja_braud
Reviews.Content: Carpet was damp when we arrived with a faint smell. Thought maybe they had just cleaned the carpet. Went to sleep. Woke up and the carpet along with everything on the floor was soaked. Room smelled terrible. We notified the front desk. They said they could only refund the parking fee without the manager. Called back numerous times over the next two months, different days, times. The manager was never to be found. This is a dirty business.

Reviews.Title: “very close to walk of fame”
Reviews.Author: jepoyzia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 10 mins from the walk of fame, easy access to public transport. lots of food options, IHOP accross the road and in-n-out burger a few doors down (a must). rooms were clean the room we had was small one and the window was a view of the corridor, most of the rooms appeared to have windows of the outside or a balcony overlooking the pool. Parking is underground which was safe you did have to pay for this but you do everywhere in hollywood. Breakfast was great lots of choices. staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 4 day sightseeing stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Mattcovmoore
Reviews.Content: Firstly, dont get this hotel confused with the Days Inn on Hollywood Boulevard - we did, and after getting dropped off at the incorrect hotel we were pleased to be staying on Sunset Blvd and not Hollywood Boulevard. LA is a massive place with no real centre, so there is no way you are going to be in close proximity to everything. If however you are looking to do the celebrity homes tour, see the Walk of Fame and where the Oscars are held etc then this is a perfect hotel only a block away from where you can see these things. It is clean, quiet and the free breakfast is more than adequate and a good way to start your day. If you want to go to Santa Monica pier and Venice beach then you can pick up the bus only a couple of blocks away, and there are adequate Metro stops in the area, should you need to go downtown, or further afield. Also Griffith Park, the largest city park in the USA is also very close. Hollywood also provides good options for restaurants etc and there is a lot going on in the evenings - we didnt feel unsafe walking the streets at night, and there were always lots of other people milling around. We spent very little time in the rooms, which are more than adequate with good bathrooms and comfy beds, but when we did stay there we were more than satisfied with them. Basically, if you want a central base from which to start sightseeing, that offers a breakfast to start your day, and is good value and doesnt compromise on quality, then Days Inn Sunset Boulevard is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: triptaker092
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the days inn last week and this place was great. It was clean and a decent room for the price. Very quiet and so close to everything. A block away from Graumans. I was hesitant to be walking back to the room at 11pm, but with an in & out next door, the street was busy and lots of people all around. 7-11 was close by as was the Jim Hansen studio. Parking was underground and $8, but it was worth it to be able to walk everywhere. Once again the location made our trip. We didn't stay much in the hotel except to sleep and it was quiet and comfortable. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except for the horror woman on reception”
Reviews.Author: GordyThePom
Reviews.Content: The woman on reception (in her fifties-sixites) needs to find another job other than dealing with holidaying customers! She was totally miserable! When asked for the foyer toilet key she just grabbed it & slammed it down on the counter - never said a word. At the end of the stay she wanted to charge for a room safe that didn't work (you get charged for the safe whether you use it or not!!! -get that!!!), our safe was useless but she still demanded that it be paid for until our argument won over! Quite pathetic! Other than the geriatric, the place was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMama87
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends went down there for NBA All-Star Weekend and I have to admit I was scared after reading some of the reviews on here. I think they must get this hotel confused with the Days Inn on H-Wood Blvd because this one was perfect. Small but quaint room, everything VERY clean, nice pool, great underground parking, breakfast was kinda mediocre but who really cares about breakfast when you're on vacay in LA? It's close to TONS of Shopping/Tourist Sites/Restaurants/Niteclubs, you name it it's in walking vicinity to the hotelOverall great stay, VERY PLEASED and will stay again next time I'm in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Frankles71
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were very impressed with the location, also the underground parking was very secure. the rooms were nice and clean. The staff on reception were helpful, also we only used the restaurant for breakfast in the mornings but was pleased with the cleanliness. But for the price and location you can't go wrong, will use this hotel again as the location is just right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel located near Hollywood Highland station”
Reviews.Author: awesome_world2010
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel located near Hollywood/Highland station (about 7 min walk), so it's close to Walk of Fame, Grauman Chinese Theater, and Madame Tussauds wax museum. The room was pretty clean, it has basic things like fridge, TV with lots of channels (I've never been to a hotel with so many chanels... this is great to amuse me all evening!), clean bathroom. I would stay in this hotel again in the future. The hotel is located right next to In-n-Out burger (which is a must try, great burgers!) and 7-Eleven is only about 2 min walk away if you need to stock up snacks and drinks in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works .. and the maids are non-existent. Expected a lot more!”
Reviews.Author: cbmagic
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot more for this hotel. I'd give the rooms a 2 out of 5. Nothing worked, the key cards (which you need to open ALL of the doors in the hotel. Including the elevator to get to your car) did not work at all. You had to try it at least 5 or 6 times to get anything to open, and once it did it would only give you a second to open the door or you had to try again. It was almost like a game. The internet access in the room was horrendous, so don't expect to get online at all. You have to pay for parking if you have a car, $8 a night, and if you come back late as I do there is no guarantee that you'll even have a spot in their very small garage under the hotel. The staff was friendly but once your checked in it's like they wanted nothing to do with you until you checked out. The good thing is the location, it's right on the Sunset strip with access to everything. Although pulling out of the parking lot could take you 10 minutes because of the traffic. It's not the absolute worst place I've stayed in, as I hit about 30 hotels a year for work. But I wouldn't go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AFFORDABLE HOTEL IN WEST HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: SORIANO007
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised with this hotel, the location is excellent, the rooms are clean and big enough, and it has very affordable rates. I went to Los Angeles with my parents just for shopping, and I found this hotel which actually exceeded all my expectations. Just in front of th hotel you can find a "Ross Dress for Less" store, within walking distance you can go to the Hollywood & Highland Center (a beautiful Mall), and some blocks away you can also go to a Target Store and Best Buy Electronics. Also the hotel has a very secure underground parking (8 USD per day), an excellent continental breakfast, and the staff was very helpful!! The only problem that you may find is that the hotel is a little bit old, it needs a renovation, but nothing to worry about, the rooms are very clean, and that's the most important. You can't expect a luxurious hotel for the price, but overall it's a great affordable hotel in a great West Hollywood location, were you can have a very comfortable stay. I will surely return to this hotel, I will tell everyone to give it a chance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value...for LA - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kai2k
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Days Inn Sunset. As with most hotels, the pictures on-line make it out to be a touch better than it actually is. I class it as a fair priced, no frills hotel in a very good location. The rooms are clean, although some are better than others. The ground floor seems better as the rooms are a touch larger, they have a living area and sofa which is handy for suitcases etc. The wi-fi is free and a reasonable speed. The pool is clean and big enough to swim in. Parking is $10 a night. Breakfast is included, which is a selection of fruit, pastries, toast, tea, coffee, juice, bagels etc. It's not bad, but there's an iHop over the road if you prefer. The location is very good, a stones throw away from the walk of fame. The reception staff are helpful. Beds and showers are up to par, and there is a safe in each room which is complimentary. I'd stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: emmathewanderer
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Clean and functional hotel. Helpful staff. I stayed as a solo traveller for 3 nights without a car and from here I could easily and safely walk to all the local tourist spots as well as the metro. Perfecto.

Reviews.Title: “Generally pleasant but a couple of issues you need to know!!”
Reviews.Author: THETRUEMEZ
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in this Hotel for two nights and it is a generally pleasant Hotel but it has a couple of inssues you need to be aware of to help you decide if this is the place for you Firstly the positives: The Reception which greets you is very neat and tidy and pleasant as are the Receptionist who are polite and most helpful. There is a complimentary breakfast of cerial and fresh Bagels and Toast and Cereal and Fruit and of course Juice and Tea and Coffee; it was fresh and plentiful and most pleasant. Seating can be difficult at peak times but a short wait is no real problem The rooms are large enough and the Bed is extremely comfortable. It's location for Central LA for the Chinese Theate and Kodak Theatree couldn't be better really and local convenience shops and Dining makes it well located too. There is an ice dispenser [free] by the pool and also reasonably priced canned drinks machine and a snack dispenser -also reasonably priced. The price to stay is reasonable for LA. A Few Negatives you need to be aware of before you book [so you can make a proper value judgement]: If you are going to stay, a room to the back of the Hotel is better as Sunset Boulevard can and often is 'traffic noisy' at night. The room we had, on the top floor overlooking the pool, had an unpleasant smell to it -a bit 'old peoples home' smell, if that is not too politically incorrect. The shower was useles in terms of delivering Hot Water. We did complain and the Maintenance man attended swiftly but ran thre shower a while and said '..there you go...' -when I tested it with my hand I advised him it was no different, to which his response was '...let it run a while...'. You could run the shower for an hour and it would never get any warmer and it was nothing to do with peak demand -it was like that at all times BUT plenty hot water at the basin. As a water engineer, I can only assume they have Temperature limiters fitted to the showers for some obscure reason and they are set at 38 degrees to 40 degrees max and that is way too cool for a shower. This is assumed to be common to all rooms I guess. The walls are either stud or light block because there is no sound deadening between rooms so you hear the conversation next door [also the snooring] As this Hotel [rightly] does not allow smoking in it's room, smokers go out on the balcony and if they chat whilst out there and it is next to your room you WILL NOT SLEEP if this is late, although Reception do take swift action if you call them and ask them to have a quiet word. The pool is dirty in the base and on that basis, I personally would not use it. Finally if you ask reception to organise you a cab to the airport MAKE IT CLEAR you want a licenced Yellow Cab or they will order you what is losely described as limo service -a bit nicer than a cab but about $15 extra - worth knowing For me the Negatives out weighed the Positives and I would not recommend this Hotel to my friends BUT it is clean and convenient so you need to make your own vlaue judgment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: HWZJH
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome, one block away from many attractions, but the hotel was very basic. The buffett runs out of food early on and they replenish it, the room was small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “very nice budget hollywood option”
Reviews.Author: stonfix
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the bad reviews. Hotel is very nice, super clean and security is very good. We´ve got an early chek in and people in front desk were ready to help. We never used the pool but it's clean enough if you want to use it. Breakfast is ok, fruits, cereal, bread, milk, cofee and juice. Can't ask much more for the price! Parking is very ample, altough you pay an $8 fee daily. As others pointed out, the only problem I'd note is that the walls are very thin, and you can hear the noise from others room. But it's not that awful, it helps you get up early to enjoy LA.!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: frac
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what some of the people writing the earlier reviews are looking for- I thought this hotel was absolutely fantastic! The front desk was nice, check-in and out was easy. The room is nice, I didn't think it was too small as some reviews said-, good lord most people aren't going to spend much time in it anyway! Bed was comfy and big flat-screen TV. The breakfast was basic but is was also FREE! Pool was nice. Felt very secure-in fact saw 2 incidents where people tried to book rooms w/out ID and they refused them. Very good in location, you just have to get your berrings when you first get there. Did as someone suggested earlier and made the walk to Ralph's grocery a few blocks down-saved a ton on beer and water! The IHOP across the street sucks-not like the ones in the south, you get very little for your money. Happy Ending though was an AWESOME bar across the street-great food and drinks for Happy Hour. Favorite place on the Hollywood strip with good beer prices and outside seating-The Green Room. Booked the 48 hour Hop-on-Hop-off bus through Economical Adventures(researched and they had the best price) This bus is a must if you have never been to Hollywood/LA. We will def. stay at this Days Inn the next go round!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location. Free Breakfast is great.”
Reviews.Author: fleurbaby
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not big at all, we have 2 double beds in ours and there was not much space for our bags. BUT it is in a great location, Fantastic shoe shop across the road. and 5 min walk to chinese theatre. staff were nice and helpful. the price was alot cheaper than anywhere else we looked at, and for a total of 6 night stay (2 lots of 3 nights we stayed there) and saved $1100 (aus) by staying here, the breakfast is basic but free and that was a big bonus. We are staying there again in a couple of months. Great for a short term place to stay, would not want to stay there for 2 weeks but then i wouldnt stay in hollywood anywhere for 2 weeks. (free internet)

Reviews.Title: “Aren't reviews funny....”
Reviews.Author: Stitchard
Reviews.Content: It never ceases to amaze me how two people can have 2 completely different experiences. I read some of the reviews below and I can't quite believe we are talking about the same hotel! I guess that's why I never pay much attention to theatre critics - its one persons opinion. Anyway, I digress, my personal experience was this: The hotel is fairly basic BUT for the price I paid (£50 per night) in this location, I really can't complain. The hotel is definitely tired but as long as a place is clean and safe then I am happy...and it was. Obviously if I was paying £100 per night I would expect alot more. The hotel provides a lovely outdoor swimming pool, free wi fi, big flat screen TV in every room, and a great breakfast included in the price. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Hollywood boulevard. I didn't have a car so this was perfect for walking about this part of town. I would definitley stay here again, it ticks all of the boxes. If I wanted better I would pay for better. I did alot of shopping around and I couldn't find much budget accomodation in central Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “best location and value”
Reviews.Author: paultraveler11
Reviews.Content: i stayed here because of the location and value and was so happy i did. i had read some bad reviews of this place just before leaving but was pleasantly surprised. the staff was helpful and friendly. the hotel, room, and surrounding area felt safe and clean with walking distance to major hollywood attractions like the gramans chinese theater and walk of fame, where a tour bus can pick you up. they even dropped everyone off at their hotels when the tour was done. my room was great, large flat screen tv, large king size bed, marble shower. only complaint was room next to me had a french lady who spoke very loud, no fault of the hotel. GREAT STAY !!

Reviews.Title: “Only one good thing is there is very kind maintenance guy!!”
Reviews.Author: よぉ
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights for our LA trip, first of all I really regretted to choose this hotel to see our room. The room was so small, dark, noisy, and the TV & closet has been broken... We felt we were staying bad smell's dirty hole. I didn't know, what was that smell...stink!! Then, our room's phone didn't work to make local call, and asked front desk. They said if we call to local area the charge must be $6 per 1 minute. Do you believe that? The price was not for International call, I asked the front woman again "only for local call?". She said "Yes" as same answer with no expression on her face . I've never had experience such a high price's call for local area. In addition their advertisement said "All room has a cable TV" but, we could watch only 2 channel on our room's TV. Other channel signed "NO SIGNAL" on the display... During our staying, we could not check weather and news from the TV. What a awful TV!! However I agree with MS.nikki_raven's comment as my previous note. There is very kind maintenance guy who was wearing a black uniform, very tall middle age's guy. ( I didn't ask his name regrettably) He helped us to bring heavy suit case, listened our complain, and he was so friendly. Only he always helps all guests, It seems he was so busy. Only being him in the hotel saved our stay. The company of Days inn must appreciate him. I will never choose this hotel in the future. It was worst memory in our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Rooms and staff leave MUCH to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: nikki_raven
Reviews.Content: -Could not see a ramp or elevator so i had to drag my big heavy suitcase up the stairs -Was told i booked for the following 2 nights, she said she could just add on today same rate (more on this a little later) -Room was dark and dingy and smelled funky(i was scared to take my shoes off cuz the carpet was so gross) -'High speed internet"?? haha ya rite -Rooms are inside a hallway so there is no fresh air -Guests were loud and someone tried to get into my room one night -Day 2 i come back from a Dr Phil taping to find they locked me out of my room. They then treated me like i was a criminal !! I called Travelocitty and had them call the front desk but desk clerk would not deal with him as he was "busy" -I finally and convinced them to let me get my laptop out of the room but the maid was told not to let me stay in there she had to watch me only get my laptop that's it -It turns out the original desk clerk misinformed me - she didnt book an additional night she SWITCHED my booking without letting me know The only good things about this place were the location (sunset and la brea) walking distance to Hollywood and there is a Ross across the street (where i scored some awesome deals) The maids were nice and the maintenance guy was super nice too he helped me with my bags and declined my tip Also there is free continental breakfast and it is cheap (69-79$ a night) and i actually slept quite well

Reviews.Title: “DAYS Inn Beware of this Hotel Chain !!”
Reviews.Author: rjpmx
Reviews.Content: Online Reservation & Bookings are NON CANCELABLE & NON REFUNDABLE!! Buyer BEWARE! For unforeseen reasons, I had to postpone a reservation with Days Inn and I provided them with 3 days notice to either change the date or cancel the reservation and they refused to do either, stating "online bookings are non-cancellable". I offered to change my reservation to a later date, and they refused. I also had a reservation in another town with Comfort Inn & Suites and they were very accommodating of my cancellation request. As was Southwest Airlines and Dollar Rent a Car. Those companies were fantastic, but NOT Days Inn. Why would anyone consider booking at a hotel chain who will not cancel & refund or even change a reservation with plenty of advance notice? They are in the travel industry for heaven's sake, where unforeseen delays or changes occur quite often. They had enough notice to rebook the room. It wasn't like we gave them last minute notice or used the room. What an insane customer service policy for a company which relies on future customer bookings, repeat business and customer word of mouth. Myself and my employees travel very frequently throughout the western US. I'm very easy going, and don't expect much from a hotel except a clean place to sleep. I don't complain about things, I run a business and I know problems happen, and a company can only do their best to make things right. But you don't shaft a potential customer because they couldn't make it to your door. If these clowns ran a restaurant, they'd be charging you for meals you didn't eat because you called and changed or canceled your dinner reservation. By grabbing a few dollars now, this company has permanently lost a potential repeat customer and any future dollars they could have earned off of me or my company. How stupid is that? Especially after I even gave them the option of holding my funds as a credit toward a future stay. I have already re-booked my trip, and I will definitely use Southwest Airlines, Comfort Inn & Suites and Dollar Rent a Car, but I guarantee I will never book or stay at another Days Inn. Ever. And I will make damn sure I comment to everyone I meet who is traveling or considering a trip to stay away from the Days Inn chain of hotels. By the way, Days Inn is part of the Wyndham chain (Ramada, Travelodge, Super 8, Howard Johnson) If they treat customers this crappy before you get in their door, imagine how poorly they treat you during your stay. There are plenty of other hotel chains to consider besides this group of companies, I suggest you use one of the many others out there, and avoid this bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: skrsToronto
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing. We were about a 3-5 minute walk from Hollywood Blvd. (chinese theatre, kodak, madam tussauds wax museum, metro station, the information desk etc). No hotel could beat this location (except for Hotel Roosevelt which was right behind us facing Hollywood Blvd.) 2 girls went on this trip and safety wise -- well, we were very aware of our surroundings. there were random homeless ppl sitting around but they never bothered us. There were guys that whistled at us but you can probably expect that anywhere. Don't dress like a hoochie, don't walk around alone at 2am and you'll be fine. We took the metro to universal studios - took about 20 mins. (the metro gets you to the stop then you catch a universal shuttle to take you up the hill so you wont have to walk it - it was free) we went on a warner brothers studio tour - awesome - took the bus there. we went to cbs studios to be apart of the price is right audience. we ate at ashton kutchers, eva longorias and gordon ramsays restaurants. we did the full day la tour - great value! went to bel air, bev hills, santa monica, saw the famous homes, and much more. we went downtown la (by subway) and walked around there for the evening. our days were packed, we did a lot and we didn't have a car. the metro is very easy to learn and its quick! if you have any questions, feel free to msg me ... also, the continental breakfast was great - we had fruits, bagels, toast, milk, coffee, juice, ceral, danishes etc. dont be fooled at night time though - it's still open (u can get coffee and tea only) - lights are off, but u can still get that stuff cuz they leave it out! my friend and i packed up some breakfast food and took it with us on our tours!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CaliLover05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in for a week in November and would have no problem booking this hotel again. My travelling partner and I - both single females - felt completely safe and secure here as you have to use your room card to operate the doors to the hallways and elevator. Had a great room with a balcomy overlooking the pool, nice size, very clean and comfortable, nothing fancy but neither was the price. Perfect location and the excellent LA metro system made it a great starting point for everywhere else. The free breakfast was more than adequate but for those requiring a better selection, IHOP is opposite the hotel. Also found the staff very helpful and the reception desk was manned 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rainb0wbright
Reviews.Content: Had a musty & old smell in our room. We could not open our window to let in some fresh air because the lay out of the hotel. It is quite odd because they have an enclosed hallway that surrounds rooms so if we opened our window- everyone that walked past our room could see in and the wall that separated the outside from the inside has windows and shutters that did allow fresh air in- meaning fresh air from In & Out restaurant. We thought the rooms were cramped and the bathrooms were small. Please be advised that if you stay there and park there they charge you $8 per night +tax (two nights we got a charge of $18.28). I thought the location was great and loved the complementary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great price”
Reviews.Author: grandmaofmany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Inn Hollywood for two nights. It was clean and plenty comfortable. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. If you drive a extra high vehicle, it won't fit in the underground parking, but the staff is very accomodating and is willing to make arrangements to park your vehicle. The breakfast is satisfying. We didn't find any distasteful smell to our rooms (2) as indicated in other reviews. The location is centrally located between many tourist attactions. Kuddos to the whole hotel staff!! Thanks for an enjoyable hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nursey2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my friend during our three week america trip. The location of the hotel was excellent 5 min walk from the walk of fame, chinese and kodak theatres and bus tours. Also near the subway station for universal studios, which is only one stop away. The hotels decor is a bit dated and shabby. However the rooms were clean and spacious with all the amenties. The pool was big and clean and the breakfast was good. The walls are very thin so heard so noise from other rooms and the hallway and the window in our roon looked out onto the hallway so we couldnt open the blinds! The reception staff werent really that helpful either. One lady suggested we take a taxi to santa monia pier for $50 each way! However we managed to work out the buses and got there for $1.25 each way! Overall a good Hollywood base for a short stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cruiserlori
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, before a cruise, to experience Hollywood Blvd. The location is perfect for all Hollywood Blvd has to offer. It is a very easy walk to Graumann's, the Walk of Fame. etc., and is located right next door to In N Out Burger (yum!) and across street from IHOP for a great breakfast. The hotel outside and lobby is very nice, but once inside, the carpet in hallways is stained and worn, and the rooms have absolutely no soundproofing. We requested a room on the 2nd floor due to previous reviewers addressing this problem, and can't imagine how noisy the 1st floor would be, as our own footsteps drove us nuts, much less being underneath us! We heard the television in the room next door clearly enough to make out every word, and it was not up loud, just on all night. Towels had makeup stains on them (let's hope they were stains and not fresh) and the toiletries had been opened and partially used. All in all, this hotel is fine for one night and perfectly located for sightseeing, but don't stay here if you NEED sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely adequate, clean, and with perfect Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: Candyskin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a thoroughly enjoyable brief stay at the Days Inn. We were there just one night, as planned, and found it, most importantly, clean (no smoker smells at all. Big bed, in an entirely big-enough room, was spotless), and the staff was very friendly - special mention here for one of the receptionists, Ms. Anna Agababyan, who was extremely sweet, gracious and helpful from the time we checked in through our departure, when she said we were entirely fine keeping the car in the basement garage after our check-out time to enable us to meet friends for lunch a few blocks away (I found it unbelievable that someone had previously griped on the Net about the garage's roof being too low! Get a life, folks!). Big TV in our room worked perfectly. Breakfast, in the hotel's modestly sized but, again, clean breakfast room, was most enjoyable, plentiful and fresh - continental-style: croissants, rolls, jams, various cereals, bananas, coffee with as many refills as you want. I could go on about this Days Inn, particularly concerning its location, but you probably know all about that already. Please, people, give some of these hotels a break, and don't believe all the bad stuff a lot of sad people write. I've come to the opinion that most bad reviews are actually from bad people. I enjoyed my visit so much I became a fan of Days Inn on Facebook!

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay - very clean”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1087
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days, it was the end of our holiday in USA and it was a nice place to stay. We had stayed in about 14 differnt hotels/motels over 5 weeks. The Days Inn on Sunset was very clean and tidy and our room was nice and the bed was huge. Only problem was the shower - the water temperture was very tempermantal and the Hot and Cold symbol was aound the wrong (could have been very dangerous if children and not sensible adults using). There was and excellent supply of tolietries which were filled up constantly for entire stay, also the with the coffee making facitlities. The decor and tiled shower were lovely and the TV was good. The pool was very clean and area tidy (pool longues could have done with a clean though). The staff were ok, could have been more friendly and more knowledgable about the area (banks, post office, buses etc) though. It had a very good security system on doors and parking garage. There was a breakfast room, but we only used it to get extra milk for our coffee in our room - we drank lots. You had to pay to use the computer and the nearest laundry was around the corner, but a lovely ralphs Supermaket a walk away also IHOP (pancake resturant) over the Road and also a bar and 7/11 convenience store. It was very close to LA sights, the hotel was much nicer than the dirty city of LA. I would happily recommend the hotel but not the city!! The last day we arranged a taxi to LAX and it arrived early - check out was rushed and we feel we were over charged for our parking, as we were quoted a different price by a different staff member. Hotel was good value though as the hotel next door was the same price and nowhere near as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price - walk to Hollywood attractions”
Reviews.Author: johnr_57
